[REDACTED] you confirm that the data are truly anonymous? [REDACTED] is not sufficient that you as a researcher cannot identify the survey participants. Please note that even if the direct identifiers have been removed, these might still be personal data. Please have a look at https://admin.kuleuven.be/privacy/en/studpers/researchers#section-8 for the difference between pseudonymized and anonymized data. [REDACTED] processing of personal data at KU [REDACTED] needs to undergo a privacy review. [REDACTED] information on this procedure can be found at https://admin.kuleuven.be/privacy/en/studpers/index. [REDACTED] 3 microdata (MEqIn, LISS, PSID) seem to have some kind of procedure to request access to the data. [REDACTED] suggests there has to be signed an agreement related to confidentiality and privacy. [REDACTED] these agreements mention the privacy ‘status’ of the data? [REDACTED] please note that some of the restricted PSID datasets require an IRB approval before the dataset can be requested. [REDACTED] this applicable in this research project? 5. [REDACTED] Please note that onedrive is a cloud service, data is stored externally on [REDACTED] servers, not on KU leuven servers.
